intro: Tibouchina minor, commonly known as the lesser tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Tibouchina minor thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates.
